nl.naturalis.oaipmh.api

Class OAIPMHException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • nl.naturalis.oaipmh.api.OAIPMHException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BadResumptionTokenException

    public class OAIPMHException
extends Exception
    An OAIPMHException is thrown in response to an error condition explicitly mentioned by the OAI-PMH specs. These error conditions do not result in abnormal HTTP responses. The server still responds with HTTP 200 (OK), and the response body still contains valid OAI-PMH XML (albeit with <error> elements). Error conditions not explicitly mentioned in the specs must result in a RepositoryException. An OAIPMHException can be thrown for more than one error, i.e. you can save up all errors encountered while processing the request, and then throw one OAIPMHException containing all of these errors. This is conform the specifications, which explicitly discourage fail-fast implementations.
    Author:
    Ayco Holleman
    See Also:
    ://www.openarchives.org/OAI/openarchivesprotocol.html#ErrorConditions, Serialized Form
